prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Phoenix Wright
Description: A pianist who can't play a lick. Formerly an ace defense attorney of some renown.
Character 1
Name: Trucy Enigmar → Trucy Wright
Description: Future star magician, and Phoenix Wright's daughter. Fond of her Mr. Hat trick.
Character 2
Name: Vera Misham
Description: My client, apparently. I know nothing other than her name and mailing address.
Character 3
Name: Ema Skye
Description: Detective obsessed with forensics. In charge of the initial investigation.
Character 4
Name: Drew Misham
Description: Painter known for his illustrations. Poisoned at Drew Studio.
Character 5
Name: Valant Gramarye
Description: Popular stage magician. His overly loquacious manner can get annoying.
Character 6
Name: Spark Brushel
Description: Freelance journalist. Can smell a scoop from miles away.
Character 7
Name: Klavier Gavin
Description: Star prosecutor and leader/vocalist for the rock group, the Gavinners.
Character 8
Name: Shadi Enigmar → Zak Gramarye
Description: My client in this case. Usually goes by his stage name, "Zak Gramarye".
Character 9
Name: Magnifi Gramarye
Description: The victim in this case. Died after being shot in the head while in the hospital.
Character 10
Name: Dick Gumshoe
Description: Homicide detective at the local precinct. In charge of the initial investigation.
Character 11
Name: Apollo Justice
Description: A greenhorn defense attorney I happened to meet. I call him Apollo.
Character 12
Name: Kristoph Gavin
Description: Incarcerated at the Central Penitentiary for the murder of Shadi Smith.
Character 13
Name: Thalassa Gramarye
Description: Trucy's mother. Still missing after her sudden disappearance.
Character 14
Name: Mike Meekins
Description: Bailiff responsible for security at the trial where Zak Gramarye vanished.
Character 15
Name: Shadi Smith
Description: In reality, the magician Zak. Murdered at Russian eatery: the Borscht Bowl Club.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: How long did I yearn for one of these? Just putting it on makes me feel... ready.* (when playing as Apollo Justice) It's my all-important badge. It shows that I am a defense attorney.* (when playing as Phoenix Wright)
Evidence 1
Name: Magic Show Ticket
Description: For premier showing of a grand illusion, to be performed by the magician, Valant Gramarye.
Evidence 2
Name: Gramarye Envelope
Description: Envelope from Mr. Wright. Do not open until the time is right.
Evidence 3
Name: Vera's Card
Description: Defendant's business card. The address for Drew Studio is on the front.
Evidence 4
Name: Portrait
Description: Obtained at Drew Studio. That bit in the middle is supposed to be a person.
Evidence 5
Name: Acrylic
Description: Obtained at Drew Studio. An undersea scene in vivid colors.
Evidence 6
Name: Landscape
Description: Obtained at Drew Studio. Only half finished, the rough sketch is still visible.
Evidence 7
Name: Coffee Mug
Description: The victim's last mug of coffee. The scrawl on the side is Drew Misham's signature. Traces of the slow-acting deadly poison atroquinine were found on the rim.
Evidence 8
Name: Hidden Painting
Description: Found at Drew Studio. Notable for the large peach in the foreground.
Evidence 9
Name: Red Envelope
Description: Found in the victim's desk drawer. Appears to have been opened once and resealed. Found in the victim's desk drawer. Contains two sheets of writing paper.
Evidence 10
Name: Letter Box
Description: Drew Misham's contact with the outside world. It's empty.
Evidence 11
Name: Tiny Frame
Description: Frame measuring two inches by two inches. Bears traces of deadly poison atroquinine.
Evidence 12
Name: Brushel's Card
Description: This business card reads "Spark Brushel, Freelance Journalist".
Evidence 13
Name: Misham's Autopsy Report
Description: Death by atroquinine poisoning. Estimated time of death: 9:00-9:30 PM.
Evidence 14
Name: Crime Photo
Description: Body found in hospital room, shot in the forehead. Click here for details.
Evidence 15
Name: Magnifi's Autopsy Report
Description: Cause of death: single gunshot to the head. Estimated time of death: 11:00-11:30 PM.
Evidence 16
Name: Notebook Page
Description: Mysterious paper received just before the trial. Click here for details. Forged to look like a page of Magnifi's diary. Click here for details.
Evidence 17
Name: Magnifi's Chart
Description: Diagnosed with a malignant tumor. Given 3 months. Click here for details.
Evidence 18
Name: Small Syringe
Description: Used for administering insulin shots. Has been washed and shows no sign of use.
Evidence 19
Name: Magnifi's Letter
Description: Letter asking Zak to shoot him. Click here for details.
Evidence 20
Name: Stage Pistol
Description: Fires one real bullet. Rifling marks match bullet found in victim. No fingerprints found.
Evidence 21
Name: Magnifi's Letter 2
Description: Letter telling Valant to come at 11:20 PM. Click here for details.
Evidence 22
Name: IV Report
Description: IV stopped 10 min. after administration began. Click here for details.
Evidence 23
Name: Magnifi's Diary
Description: A memoir of sorts. Written in up to just before he died.
Evidence 24
Name: The Amazing Mr. Hat
Description: Trucy's favorite trick. Startlingly realistic.
Evidence 25
Name: Trucy's Locket
Description: Contains a photo of Trucy's mother, Thalassa.
Evidence 26
Name: Transferal of Rights
Description: Document tranferring the right to perform the Gramarye repertoire to daughter Trucy.
Evidence 27
Name: Nail Polish
Description: Retrieved from Kristoph Gavin's cell. The nail polish is colorless.
Evidence 28
Name: Commemorative Stamp
Description: Commemorative stamp showing Troupe Gramarye. Click here for details. Sent from the real "client". Click here for details.
Evidence 29
Name: Thalassa's Portrait
Description: Photo of a young Thalassa, Trucy's mother. Click here for details.
Evidence 30
Name: Zak's Confession
Description: Confession to the slaying of Magnifi Gramarye. Click here for details.
Evidence 31
Name: Letter from Misham
Description: Letter posted by Drew Misham just before dying. Poison traces found on the stamp.
Evidence 32
Name: Letter from Mr. Wright
Description: Reproduction of information found by Mr. Wright during his investigation.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: I visited the studio around 9:00 that night to do the interview.
Person: Brushel
Testimony 1
Testimony: The first outsider to enter the atelier! "Journalistic History Made", end quote!
Person: Brushel
Testimony 2
Testimony: His daughter brought us coffee right after we started.
Person: Brushel
Testimony 3
Testimony: And you know what happened next. "Star Falls!" end quote.
Person: Brushel
Testimony 4
Testimony: Those spasms... That was definitely death by poison.
Person: Brushel
Testimony 5
Testimony: I drank the coffee, too, but I'm not dead yet!
Person: Brushel
Testimony 6
Testimony: He had one sip, if that. The next moment, he was on the floor!
Person: Brushel
Testimony 7
Testimony: No one else entered the room besides her the whole time.
Person: Brushel

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, let's try to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other. I need to go through each testimony and check if any of the evidence directly contradicts what's being said.

First, looking at the testimonies by Brushel. Testimony 0 says he visited the studio around 9:00 PM for an interview. Testimony 2 mentions that the daughter brought coffee right after they started. Testimony 5 says Brushel drank the coffee too but isn't dead. Testimony 6 states that Drew Misham had one sip and then collapsed. Testimony 7 claims no one else entered the room besides the daughter the whole time.

Now, the evidence. Let's see. Evidence 13 is Misham's Autopsy Report: death by atroquinine poisoning, time between 9:00-9:30 PM. If Brushel was there at 9:00 PM and the coffee was served right after, then Misham would have been poisoned around that time. But the autopsy says time of death is 9:00-9:30. However, the poison used is atroquinine, which is slow-acting. Wait, evidence 7 (Coffee Mug) says traces of slow-acting poison atroquinine were found on the rim. So if Misham drank the coffee at 9:00 PM, the poison would take time. But the autopsy says time of death is the same time as when he drank it? That's a contradiction. Because slow-acting poison wouldn't kill instantly. So Testimony 6 says he had one sip and immediately collapsed, but the poison is slow-acting. So that's a contradiction between Testimony 6 and Evidence 7. Wait, but Testimony 6 says he was on the floor the next moment. So the coffee would have had a fast-acting poison, but the evidence says it's slow-acting. Therefore, Testimony 6 (he died immediately after drinking) contradicts Evidence 7 (poison is slow-acting). So the testimony 6 and evidence 7 contradict each other. Let me check the other possibilities. 

Also, Testimony 7 says no one else entered the room besides the daughter. But maybe there's evidence that someone else did. Let me check. Evidence 31 is the Letter from Misham, which was posted just before dying, and poison traces on the stamp. But that might not directly relate to the testimony. Evidence 10 is the Letter Box, which is empty. Not sure. Alternatively, maybe the autopsy report (Evidence 13) says time of death up to 9:30 PM, but if Brushel was there at 9 PM and the coffee was served, then Misham died within the same time frame. But if the poison is slow-acting, the death should be later. However, the autopsy time of death is 9-9:30 PM, which includes the time the coffee was served. Hmm. But if the poison is slow, maybe the time of death would be later. Wait, maybe the actual time of death is later than when the poison was administered. But the autopsy report here says the time of death is 9-9:30 PM, same as when the coffee was given. That would contradict the slow-acting nature. So if Brushel says Misham drank the coffee at 9 PM and immediately collapsed (Testimony 6), but the poison takes time, then the death should be later. But the autopsy report (Evidence 13) says time of death is 9-9:30, which might not be a contradiction because maybe the poison was fast enough to act within 30 minutes. Wait, but the evidence says "slow-acting". So if the poison is slow-acting, then Misham would have died hours later, not immediately. Therefore, Testimony 6 (collapsed next moment) contradicts Evidence 7 (slow-acting poison). That seems right. So the pair is Evidence 7 and Testimony 6.

Testimony 0
Testimony: When I arrived at the studio, Mr. Misham was at his desk.
Person: Brushel
Testimony 1
Testimony: He seemed to be writing a letter... but he quickly sealed the envelope.
Person: Brushel
Testimony 2
Testimony: It was a yellow envelope. ...I heard it was left at the crime scene.
Person: Brushel
Testimony 3
Testimony: I thought nothing of it at the time, of course.
Person: Brushel
Testimony 4
Testimony: Now that I think about it, what if he was writing a suicide note!?

cot:
Okay, let's try to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other here. I need to look through all the testimonies and see if any of them are contradicted by the evidence provided.

First, looking at the testimonies. All of them are from Brushel. Testimony 0 says he arrived at the studio and saw Mr. Misham at his desk. Testimony 1 mentions Misham writing a letter and sealing an envelope. Testimony 2 describes the envelope as yellow and says Brushel heard it was left at the crime scene. Testimony 3 is just him saying he thought nothing of it, and Testimony 4 speculates it might be a suicide note.

Now, checking the evidences. Let's see if any of the evidence contradicts these statements. The key points here are the envelope and the letter. 

Evidence 31 is the Letter from Misham, which was posted by Drew Misham just before dying and has poison on the stamp. But Brushel's testimony 2 says the envelope was yellow and left at the crime scene. However, Evidence 31 is a letter that was posted, not left at the scene. Also, Evidence 9 is the Red Envelope found in the victim's drawer, opened and resealed. Testimony 2 mentions a yellow envelope, but Evidence 9 is red. That's a contradiction. Because Brushel says the envelope he saw was yellow and left at the crime scene, but the Red Envelope (Evidence 9) is actually in the victim's drawer. Wait, but the testimony says he heard it was left at the crime scene. Hmm. Alternatively, maybe the Letter from Misham (Evidence 31) was sent, so it's not at the scene. 

Wait, Testimony 2 says the envelope was yellow and left at the crime scene, but Evidence 9 is a Red Envelope found in the victim's desk. The color discrepancy here would be a contradiction. Brushel says yellow, but the evidence is red. So Evidence 9 (Red Envelope) contradicts Testimony 2 (yellow envelope). But wait, Testimony 2's person is Brushel, who is testifying about seeing a yellow envelope. If the actual evidence found is a red one, that's a contradiction. So the testimony says yellow, but the evidence is red. Therefore, Evidence 9 and Testimony 2 contradict. Alternatively, there's also Evidence 2, the Gramarye Envelope from Mr. Wright, but that's a different thing. 

Wait, let me check the details again. Testimony 2: "It was a yellow envelope. ...I heard it was left at the crime scene." So Brushel is saying the envelope he saw Misham seal was yellow, and he later heard that envelope was left at the crime scene. But Evidence 9 is a Red Envelope found in the victim's desk. So if the envelope at the crime scene (from the testimony) is supposed to be yellow, but the found envelope is red, that's a contradiction. Therefore, Testimony 2 (which says yellow) is contradicted by Evidence 9 (which is red). But wait, Evidence 9 is found in the victim's desk, not necessarily the same as the crime scene. Wait, Drew Misham's crime scene would be his studio where he was poisoned. The Red Envelope (Evidence 9) is found in his desk, which is the same place. But Brushel says the envelope he saw Misham seal was yellow and was left at the crime scene. However, if the envelope found in the desk (the crime scene) is red, that contradicts his testimony. Therefore, Evidence 9 (Red Envelope) contradicts Testimony 2 (yellow envelope). So the pair would be Evidence 9 and Testimony 2. 

Alternatively, let's check other possibilities. Testimony 1 says Misham sealed the envelope. Evidence 31 is a letter posted by Misham just before dying. If Brushel saw Misham writing a letter, which he sealed, and that letter was sent (Evidence 31), then the envelope would be the one sent, not left at the scene. But Brushel says the envelope was left at the scene. So maybe the contradiction is that Brushel's testimony claims the envelope was left at the scene (Testimony 2), but the actual letter sent (Evidence 31) was posted, not left there. However, the problem is that Testimony 2 says the envelope was left at the crime scene, but the evidence (31) is about a letter that was posted, so it's not at the scene. Therefore, if Brushel says the envelope was left at the scene, but the actual evidence shows that Misham posted a letter (Evidence 31), then the presence of Evidence 31 contradicts Testimony 2. But the color isn't mentioned in Evidence 31. Alternatively, maybe the envelope in the desk (Evidence 9) is red, which contradicts Brushel's claim that the envelope he saw was yellow. So the contradiction is between Testimony 2 (yellow) and Evidence 9 (red). Therefore, the answer would be {"evidence": 9, "testimony": 2}.

Wait, but in the evidence list, Evidence 9 is the Red Envelope found in the victim's desk. So Brushel testifies that the envelope he saw was yellow and left at the crime scene (which would be the studio where Misham died). But the actual envelope found in the desk is red. Therefore, this is a contradiction in color. So Evidence 9 (Red Envelope) contradicts Testimony 2 (yellow envelope). Therefore, the correct pair is evidence 9 and testimony 2.
